intro: Saussurea zogangensis, commonly known as the Zogang Saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Nepal and India. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow flowers. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
